meanings.def: rising or falling quickly, not gradually
examples: The path grew steeper as we climbed higher.
The steep banks of the river are largely tree-covered.
a steep decline in the birth rate
Setting up a new business is risky and involves a steep learning curve.
£4 for a cup of coffee seems a little steep to me.
He wants to move in here with us? That’s a bit steep!

meanings.def: if you steep food in a liquid or leave it to steep, you put it in the liquid and leave it for some time so that it becomes soft and takes in the taste of the liquid
examples: steep something (in something) Steep the fruit in brandy overnight.
steep (in something) Black teas need to steep for three minutes.

meanings.def: to have a lot of a particular quality

idioms.def: to have a lot of a particular quality
